content.question: Which of the following is played?

choices.label: Score A has one staff in the bass clef. There are no key signatures and they all have a time signature of common time. It has only one measure and its rhythm is the same: quarter, eighth, eighth, and half. The pitches in score A are: G3, F sharp 3, B3, and G3.

Score B has one staff in the bass clef. There are no key signatures and they all have a time signature of common time. It has only one measure and its rhythm is the same: quarter, eighth, eighth, and half. The pitches in score B are: G3, F sharp 3, A3, and G3.

Score C has one staff in the bass clef. There are no key signatures and they all have a time signature of common time. It has only one measure and its rhythm is the same: quarter, eighth, eighth, and half. The pitches in score C are: G3, F3, B flat 3, and G3.

Score D has one staff in the bass clef. There are no key signatures and they all have a time signature of common time. It has only one measure and its rhythm is the same: quarter, eighth, eighth, and half. The pitches in score D are: G3, F3, A3, and G3.

content.answer: Score B has one staff in the bass clef. There are no key signatures and they all have a time signature of common time. It has only one measure and its rhythm is the same: quarter, eighth, eighth, and half. The pitches in score B are: G3, F sharp 3, A3, and G3.

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Use symbols and terms to describe features of pitch in performed music, including pitch patterns and relationships, melodic features, chords, harmonic progressions, and cadences.
